page.title: 19Local History
page.content: Abergele is situated on the river gele on the coastal plain, at the foot of the limestone upland which forms the western slope of the Vale of Clwyd. This was a position favoured for centuries by travellers being the easiest route from the industrial populated areas to the east. Abergele is one of the oldest settlements in the area, Rhyl, Colwyn Bay and Llandudno being relatively modern. For centuries the limestone hills have attracted settlers, fresh water being readily accessible along a spring line and caves formed through water errotion provided habitation. In 755 AD Elfod Bishop of Bangor granted a piece of land on the banks of the river Gele to build a church. This Church became the nucleus of the settlement.
